Home > MLVcode > edges-master > toolbox-master > external > deprecated > normxcorrn_fg.m

normxcorrn_fg

PURPOSE

Normalized n-dimensional cross-correlation with a mask.

SYNOPSIS

function C = normxcorrn_fg( T, T_fg, A, shape )

DESCRIPTION 

 Normalized n-dimensional cross-correlation with a mask.

 Similar to normxcorrn, except takes an additional argument that specifies
 a figure ground mask for the T.  That is T_fg must be of the same
 dimensions as T, with each entry being 0 or 1, where zero specifies
 regions to ignore (the ground) and 1 specifies interesting regions (the
 figure).  Essentially T_fg specifies regions in T that are interesting
 and should be taken into account when doing normalized cross correlation.
 This allows for templates of arbitrary shape, and not just squares.

 Note: this function is approximately 3 times slower then normxcorr2
 because it cannot use the trick of precomputing sums.

 USAGE
  C = normxcorrn_fg( T, T_fg, A, [shape] )

 INPUTS
  T           - template to correlate to each window in A
  T_fg        - figure/ground mask for the template
  A           - matrix to correlate T to
  shape       - ['full'] 'valid', 'full', or 'same', see convn_fast help

 OUTPUTS
  C           - correlation matrix

 EXAMPLE
  A=rand(50);  B=rand(11);  Bfg=ones(11);
  C1=normxcorrn_fg(B,Bfg,A);  C2=normxcorr2(B,A);
  figure(1); im(C1); figure(2); im(C2);
  figure(3); im(abs(C1-C2));

 See also NORMXCORRN

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

SOURCE CODE 

0001 % Normalized n-dimensional cross-correlation with a mask.
0002 %
0003 % Similar to normxcorrn, except takes an additional argument that specifies
0004 % a figure ground mask for the T.  That is T_fg must be of the same
0005 % dimensions as T, with each entry being 0 or 1, where zero specifies
0006 % regions to ignore (the ground) and 1 specifies interesting regions (the
0007 % figure).  Essentially T_fg specifies regions in T that are interesting
0008 % and should be taken into account when doing normalized cross correlation.
0009 % This allows for templates of arbitrary shape, and not just squares.
0010 %
0011 % Note: this function is approximately 3 times slower then normxcorr2
0012 % because it cannot use the trick of precomputing sums.
0013 %
0014 % USAGE
0015 %  C = normxcorrn_fg( T, T_fg, A, [shape] )
0016 %
0017 % INPUTS
0018 %  T           - template to correlate to each window in A
0019 %  T_fg        - figure/ground mask for the template
0020 %  A           - matrix to correlate T to
0021 %  shape       - ['full'] 'valid', 'full', or 'same', see convn_fast help
0022 %
0023 % OUTPUTS
0024 %  C           - correlation matrix
0025 %
0026 % EXAMPLE
0027 %  A=rand(50);  B=rand(11);  Bfg=ones(11);
0028 %  C1=normxcorrn_fg(B,Bfg,A);  C2=normxcorr2(B,A);
0029 %  figure(1); im(C1); figure(2); im(C2);
0030 %  figure(3); im(abs(C1-C2));
0031 %
0032 % See also NORMXCORRN
0033 
0034 % Piotr's Image&Video Toolbox      Version 1.5
0035 % Written and maintained by Piotr Dollar    pdollar-at-cs.ucsd.edu
0036 % Please email me if you find bugs, or have suggestions or questions!
0037 
0038 function C = normxcorrn_fg( T, T_fg, A, shape )
0039 if( nargin <4 || isempty(shape)); shape='full'; end;
0040 
0041 if( ndims(T)~=ndims(A) || ndims(T)~=ndims(T_fg) )
0042   error('TEMPALTE, T_fg, and A must have same number of dimensions'); end;
0043 if( any(size(T)~=size(T_fg)))
0044   error('TEMPALTE and T_fg must have same dimensions'); end;
0045 if( ~all(T_fg==0 | T_fg==1))
0046   error('T_fg may have only entries either 0 or 1'); end;
0047 nkeep = sum(T_fg(:));
0048 if( nkeep==0); error('T_fg must have some nonzero values'); end;
0049 
0050 % center T on 0 and normalize magnitued to 1, excluding ground
0051 % T= (T-T_av) / ||(T-T_av)||
0052 T(T_fg==0)=0;
0053 T = T - sum(T(:)) / nkeep;
0054 T(T_fg==0)=0;
0055 T = T / norm( T(:) );
0056 
0057 % flip for convn_fast purposes
0058 for d=1:ndims(T); T = flipdim(T,d); end;
0059 for d=1:ndims(T_fg); T_fg = flipdim(T_fg,d); end;
0060 
0061 % get average over each window over A
0062 A_av = convn_fast( A, T_fg/nkeep, shape );
0063 
0064 % get magnitude over each window over A "mag(WA-WAav)"
0065 % We can rewrite the above as "sqrt(SUM(WAi^2)-n*WAav^2)". so:
0066 A_mag = convn_fast( A.*A, T_fg, shape ) - nkeep * A_av .* A_av;
0067 A_mag = sqrt(A_mag);  A_mag(A_mag<.000001)=1; %removes divide by 0 error
0068 
0069 % finally get C.  in each image window, we will now do:
0070 % "dot(T,(WA-WAav)) / mag(WA-WAav)"
0071 C = convn_fast(A,T,shape) - A_av*sum(T(:));
0072 C = C ./ A_mag;
